title: Letters: SNP betrays historical ties by encouraging vicious anti-English feeling
text:
S IR – It saddens me to see anti-English hostility whipped up in Scotland by the SNP . My brother has felt forced to move his family back to England after years living near Stirling.
Changes in attitude to the English in Scotland have corresponded closely with the rise of the SNP and a desire for a scapegoat for Scottish problems.
Ironically my great-grandfather fled hunger and the Clearances to find work and a welcome in Liverpool. Many Scots found a similar escape from poverty but they never forgot their native country.
Families worldwide share these connections, which are threatened by the SNP’s vicious posturing.
S T Bryce
Bedlington, Northumberland
